title: How high-profile scientists felt tricked by group denying climate change
description: Politicians and scientists say they were duped by an organisation making false claims about global warming.

title: Australia election: Why is there compulsory voting?
description: It is one of the only English-speaking nations to have mandatory voting, and people widely support it.

title: Viola Davis responds to critics of her Michelle Obama portrayal
description: The actress had been criticised by viewers for overly pursing her lips when playing Michelle Obama.

title: Sex for Water: What price are women and girls paying?
description: Women and girls are exposed to sexual violence as private vendors control the water supply in Kenya.

title: Watch Neil Robertson's 147 at the World Snooker Championship sped up
description: Watch Neil Robertson's 147 break at the 2022 World Snooker Championship second round in under two minutes.

title: Ukraine round-up: Russia hits railways as US pledges extra weapons
description: A chilling account of a Russian filtration camp and US hopes for Russia to be "weakened".

title: Twitter: Why Elon Musk has been so keen on taking control
description: The billionaire has called for a series of changes from relaxing Twitter's content restrictions to eradicating fake accounts.

title: Ukraine: Facing the Russian Army on the front line in Donbas
description: Ukrainian forces have been holding the line in Donbas since 2014, but what was sporadic fighting has now turned into a full-blown war.

title: Twitter shares rise as reports say Elon Musk deal close
description: The social media giant is reported to be in the final stages of a takeover deal with Elon Musk.

title: Asda and Morrisons cut prices as supermarkets fight for customers
description: Morrisons and Asda launch new promotions as households face pressure from the rising cost of living.

title: Raheem Sterling: Why Man City fans don't appreciate him enough - Micah Richards analysis
description: BBC pundit Micah Richards feels Manchester City fans should focus on what Raheem Sterling brings to their team, rather than just remember his missed chances.

title: 'You can't imagine the conditions' - Accounts emerge of Russian detention camps
description: Those who have fled the Ukrainian city say people are being held in cramped, unclean camps.

title: Beijing kicks off mass testing after spike in Covid cases
description: Dozens of cases were reported, sparking fears that Beijing could face a similar situation to Shanghai.

title: Bermondsey stabbings: Four killed in south-east London home
description: A man is arrested on suspicion of murder after three women and a man are found dead in Bermondsey.

title: Ukraine war: US wants to see a weakened Russia
description: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said he hoped to see the Russian military depleted in Ukraine.

title: P&O Ferries hits back at staff pay cut claim
description: The firm says it has not asked recently-employed agency workers to sign new contracts with reduced wages.

title: M1 crash: Drink-drive mum jailed over deaths of children
description: Mary McCann's son and daughter were not wearing seatbelts at the time of the crash, a court hears.

title: Everton to ask why Matip challenge on Gordon was not given as penalty in Merseyside derby
description: Everton will contact the Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) to query why a challenge they feel should have led to a penalty was not reviewed further in the Merseyside derby.

title: Sexual offence victims face longest-ever court waits
description: Recent Crown Court cases have taken an average of nine months to complete, BBC investigation finds.

title: Nissan signals the end of the road for Datsun cars
description: The Japanese firm previously called the range of cars "an important part of Nissan's DNA".

title: Boris Johnson contacts Angela Rayner over newspaper misogyny claims
description: A minister says any MP who made claims about Labour's deputy leader may face "serious consequences".

title: French election result: Macron defeats Le Pen and vows to unite divided France
description: He triumphs over his far-right rival and becomes the first president to win re-election in 20 years.

title: 'Our friend was a hero. We want his music heard'
description: A year since the death of Folajimi Olubumni-Adewole, friends got his song played on Radio 1Xtra.

title: Antarctica same-sex wedding first on British territory
description: Stephen Carpenter and Eric Bourne shared their day with the 30 crew of the UK's new polar ship.

title: French election 2022: What happened on the night?
description: Jubilant supporters greet Macron at the Eiffel Tower, while there's disappointment for those with Le Pen.

title: Ukraine war: False TikTok videos draw millions of views
description: Misleading videos have been viewed by millions as it struggles to deal with so much false material.

title: SpaceX: Can meat be grown in space?
description: An experiment to find out has just finished on the International Space Station.

title: The high-tech fitness mirrors that aim to get you exercising more
description: The machines allow the user to see both his or her reflection and a video of an online instructor.

title: Ten Percent: Can Call My Agent's British remake recapture the magic?
description: The French TV series has been adapted for an English-language audience. Its writer explains why.
